name: UnityBuildTask
description: Build a Unity project and get the exported output files.
helpMarkDown: Builds a Unity project to supported build target platforms. [More Information](https://github.com/Dinomite-Studios/unity-azure-pipelines-tasks)
author: Dinomite Studios

inputs.name: buildTarget
inputs.label: Build Target
inputs.helpMarkDown: Build platform to build the Unity project for.

inputs.name: unityEditorsPathMode
inputs.label: Unity Editors Location
inputs.helpMarkDown: Define where to look for Unity installations on the agent.

options.environmentVariable: Use UNITYHUB_EDITORS_FOLDER_LOCATION environment variable on agent

inputs.name: customUnityEditorsPath
inputs.label: Editors Folder Location
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify where to look for Unity Editor versions on the agent.

inputs.name: unityProjectPath
inputs.label: Unity Project Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Enter the directory path to the Unity project. If no value is entered, the root of the repository will be used.

inputs.name: buildScriptType
inputs.label: Build Script Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Build script type: Use `Default` to use a built-in simple script which will perform a build without additional options. Use `Existing` if you already have a build script in your source and only need to specify the method to execute on build. Or use `Inline` to define the script inline, please make sure it's valid C#.

inputs.name: outputPath
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the build output path relative to the repository root or fully qualified.
inputs.label: Output Path

inputs.name: outputFileName
inputs.label: Output Filename
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the output filename to be used when constructing the platform-appropriate output.  For instance, if you want the output to be 'thegame.exe' on Windows Standalone, enter 'thegame'

inputs.name: inlineBuildScript
inputs.label: Inline Build Script
inputs.helpMarkDown: Write your C# build script here. Define a class and make sure to define a public static method to execute for the build. You'll want to verify your script actually works on your local computer.

inputs.name: scriptExecuteMethod
inputs.label: Build Script Execute Method
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify class and method name of the method to execute in your build script separated by a dot. E.g. `MyClass.PerformBuild`

inputs.name: additionalCmdArgs
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Specify additional command line arguments, see the [documentation](https://docs.unity3d.com/Manual/CommandLineArguments.html) for more info.

OutputVariables.name: logsOutputPath
OutputVariables.description: Path to the Unity editor log files generated.

messages.BuildFailed: The Unity build failed with exit code
messages.WarningAlphaBetaVersion: You are using a Unity Alpha/Beta version. It may not be supported by the extension!
messages.ProjectPathInfo: Determining Unity editor version for project at
messages.FailGetUnityEditorVersion: Fail, Unity editor version not found
